page.title: 01BURNHAM BEECHES,BUCKS
page.content: Burnham Beeches is a heavily wooded public open space in the county of Buckinghamshire,owned and managed by the corporation of London since 1880.It is situated between the M4 and the M40 motorways soon to be linked by the M25.Lying West of the A355.It is between the industrial town of Slough to the South and the residental areas of Beaconsfield to the North,Burnham to the West and Farnham Common to the East."The Beeches"form part of the liberty of East Burnham in the Parish of Burnham.The area is of great historic interest and is registered by the Nature Conservancy as being of scientific interest.It affords 6 Miles of motor roads,much walking area, recreational facilities and scope for environmental study by schools.
